channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA

item.title: Report X-2023120505
item.description:
Report X-2023120505

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: MONROE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tank car was reported to be leaking by UPRR train crew personnel when they coupled into the car. Mgr. of Hazardous Materials Tom Robinson was called for a response. The tank car was found to have one man way swing bolt tightened down harder than the others causing the man way lid to be slightly cocked open. The man way lid was properly secured, and the car was moved back and forth to assure it was properly secured. Mgr. Robinson documented the new seal numbers, and the car was allowed to continue in transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023120680
item.description:
Report X-2023120680

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: CARENCRO
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to Nonconveyable roller on Belt 1. Package was put on roller and powder fell from corners of box. Package was brought to QA Processing area. DescribePack: Upon inspection plastic drum was found to be damaged. Bottom of plastic drum is broken and powder spilled out into box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately taken out of sortation and placed in QA processing area. Package was placed inside blue hazmat bag inside hazmat drummed and processed.

item.title: Report E-2023120478
item.description:
Report E-2023120478

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a one-quart release of UN1133 "Black-Out RTU" arrived damaged at Terminal LSL. The terminal stated that (1) a one-gallon plastic pail was punctured by other freight during transit after falling from its pallet due to not being properly secured impacting the trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the caller who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 55-gallon poly drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the damaged metal pail, the remaining product, and issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110998
item.description:
Report X-2023110998

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T00:33:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-29
  • City: GEISMAR
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 30, 2023, at 1930 hours, during switching operations on the south end of the CN Geismar yard, a CN crew switched a cut of cars into track GE02. Upon coupling into a stationary cut of cars, product was observed releasing from the top of one of the railcars. The local Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) was immediately notified of the release. Upon arrival at the yard, the DGO observed product on the exterior of RCRX 1684 (load / UN 1789 / Class 8). The railcar was further investigated and inspected, observing liquid around the housing and in the bowl of the external spring safety relief device indicating activation of the safety relief valve. The liquid was tested with pH paper indicating a pH of 1-2. All top fittings and closures were inspected and found to be tool tight. The railcar was observed for 45 minutes, with no additional product observed releasing. The exterior of the railcar was decontaminated. The shipper responded the next day to remove the safety relief for testing.
